Title: the wildebeest implementation

Scene: A public washroom. Amy and Penny are in cubicles, Bernadette is washing her hands.
The apartment. Sheldon is playing three person chess by himself.
us away, we love you.” I love you, too, but you cost more than my rent. “But, Penny, you look so good in us.” Damn it, the shoes are right.
Raj’s apartment. They are playing Jenga,
The apartment. Sheldon, Leonard and Howard are playing three person chess.
Amy: I must say, Penny, this is great fun.
Until I met you and Bernadette, my trips to the bathroom had been entirely focused on elimination. Now they have a delightful social aspect.
Of course I have. But they were strangers and seemed off-put when I engaged in friendly stall-to-stall chit-chat.
You okay in there, bestie?
The reason I ask is that many people experience bladder shyness, the inability to pass urine
She always this crabby when she urinates?
And I’ll be right by your side.
No, it’s not. It’s a strategic manoeuvre. Leonard’s new girlfriend is testing Bernadette’s loyalty to you and the group. That bitch is crafty.
Of course. How does the cheetah attack a herd of wildebeests? By going after its weakest member.
Your trusting nature coupled with your teeny-tiny body. You wouldn’t last a minute on the Serengeti.
Oh, no. You have to go.
You are, with hair that smells like strawberries. And we’re going to use that to our advantage.

By accepting the invitation, Bernadette becomes a double agent inside the enemy camp. She could ferret out Priya’s tactics, identify her weaknesses and feed her false information, such as, Leonard’s no stranger to back-alley cockfights.
Don’t worry. I’ll teach you. I did two years of Cub Scouts before they found out I was a girl.
How do you feel about concealing a recording device in the cleavage of your ample bosom?
Come on, Strawberries. Take one for the team.
Oh, my metatarsal are barking.
Yeah, yeah. I’m just breaking in some new shoes.
Thank you. Did you know that women wear high heels to make the buttocks and breasts more prominent?
Look.
Please, Leonard, don’t leer, you have a girlfriend.
So, are you off to dinner with Priya, Howard and Bernadette?
I heard it at the mall, when I was shopping with my girlfriends, ’cause, you know, that’s kind of my life now. Have a good night. Try not to ogle my caboose as I walk away.
I don’t understand. Is this a way to break in new shoes?
Bernadette is with Priya and Leonard. Message received. Commence operation “Priya Wouldn’t Wanna Be-ya.”
I wish. A clique requires friends. I didn’t have any.

I used to take my lunch down to the maintenance room and eat with the janitor. It was nice until his wife called me a puta and made me stop. Hang on. It’s the wildebeest. Priya just made a snide comment about your acting career.
She thinks it’s cool you’re following your dream, no matter what.
How do you want to handle it?
Got it. Is it going to be in 3-D?
I’m gonna say 3-D. That’ll let her know the studio has faith in it.
Good golly, Penny, your whimsy is boundless. (Phone rings) What do you got for me, wildebeest?
Calm down. Everything’s going to be okay. (To Penny) We may have to kill her. Bernadette, I’m putting you on speakerphone. Where are you now?
Oh, look at this, another one of our classic bathroom gabfests. What’s the problem?
Just change the subject.
What astronaut story?
I texted architect. That’s amusing. Auto-correct must’ve changed it.
Architect. Where would you have met an astronaut?
Penny: Glad you’re enjoying yourself.
I’m fine.
Yeah, I said I’m fine. Stop talking to me.
Screw it. I’ll go later.
Oh, that’s nice.

Okay, Amy, you’re being silly. I am not concerned about who hangs out with who. And I certainly don’t have a problem with Leonard’s new girlfriend who wears way too much makeup. Ooh, these are cute. Of course if I buy them, I’ll have to rent my womb out to a gay couple.
Wait. What are you talking about?
Okay, I don’t know you people. I’m just an innocent woman wondering if this shoe store will take my Texaco card.
No. Once these puppies touch the ground they’re mine, and I’ll have to wear them walking up and down Hollywood Boulevard in order to pay them off. Pretty, pretty, pretty.
The what?
Hey. Seriously? Didn’t you get enough of this cliquey crap in high school?
None?
Wh… What the hell did she say?
That bitch!
Um, okay. Tell Bernadette to tell Priya that I’m on my way to Prague to shoot a movie with Angelina Jolie.
What? I don’t know. It doesn’t matter.
What?
What, are they getting engaged?
All right, look, just forget about the astronaut.
Look, just find out what’s up with this trip to India.
Don’t you quit on us!
Bernadette: Amy, you must’ve been in the bathroom with other women before.
Some women don’t like to get chummy when their panties are down.
We’re really not that close.
Did I tell you Priya invited me and Howard to have dinner with her and Leonard?
You think?
Well, what makes me the weakest member?
It doesn’t matter. I’m going to tell her we can’t make it.
I don’t understand. I thought I was a teeny-tiny wildebeest.
I don’t know. I’m not a very good liar. They kind of whup that out of you in Catholic school.
I don’t want anything in my ample bosom.
That’s what I hear.
She’s also dating an astronaut.
Yeah. But Leonard’s impressive, too.
I don’t know. The regular way people meet astronauts.
Obviously, this one doesn’t.
Leonard lives here. Priya’s from India. People meet, Howard. God!
You’ve met lots of astronauts, and I’ve never grilled you about that. I’d thank you to extend me the same courtesy.
Maybe that’s where she met the astronaut, all right?
He’s a consultant.
He can’t have a hobby? Excuse me, I have to pee. Or is that implausible, as well?
In the bathroom.
They’re just asking me all sorts of questions I can’t answer.
I suppose I could get them back to talking about Leonard going to India to meet Priya’s parents.
They said something about going there this summer.
I don’t know. I was too busy covering my heinie on Amy’s stupid astronaut story!
You texted me Penny’s dating an astronaut.
Yeah, it’s hysterical.
I don’t want to do this anymore!
Let me help you.
This trip to India sounds fun.
Are you concerned your parents might not approve of Leonard?
Well, I wouldn’t worry about it. It’s not like you guys are getting engaged, right?
Not engaged. Very interesting. I have to tinkle.
Yes. Are you writing a book?
I’m not upset. Maybe you’re upset.
I can’t do this anymore! I’m a good girl! I went to Catholic school! (Storms out,)
Leonard: Okay, now I have to ask. What do they do?
Okay, well, I look forward to playing with you.
Excuse me, but Einstein had a pretty busy sex life.
Hi. Hey, Raj, will you be joining us for dinner?
Really? In front of your sister?
Wonder why she didn’t tell me.
Well, it’s not as much surprised as, uh, uh, you know, uh. th-th-th-the other thing.
Well, you know, if you, if, if, if you, uh, I don’t, oh, what’s the word I’m looking for?
Thank you. Befuddled. The word I was looking for was befuddled.
I still can’t get over the fact that she got a big movie part. Not that I care what my ex-girlfriend’s up to, ’cause I don’t.
I thought the movie was about 18th-century Vienna?
Gals? Who are you, Fred Flintstone?
I think the word you’re looking for is befuddled.
Hang on. When is my pawn allowed to use the golf cart?
Oh, oh, Beekeeper to King 12. I capture your Pope and release the swarm. Checkmate on Sheldon.
Sheldon: Good news. I finally have a handle on my idea for three-person chess.
Uh, do you know how I solved the balanced centre combat-area problem? Five words, transitional quadrilateral to triangular tessellation.
It’s what I do. But wait, there’s more. I also invented two new chess pieces. The serpent, and the old woman.
When the serpent slithers to an opposing player’s piece, that piece is considered poisoned and will die after two more moves. Ugh.
Unless, it gets to the old woman in time, in which case she sucks out the poison, turning her into the Grand Empress, a piece combining the power of the knight, queen and serpent.
That’s because it’s simple.
And…
And a third person. It’s three-person chess. I must say, ever since you started having regular intercourse, your mind has lost its keen edge. You should reflect on that.
Yes, and he never unified gravity with the other forces. If he hadn’t been such a hound dog, we’d all have time machines.
You know I’m right.
Knight to old woman six-and-a-third. Brilliant move. Thank you. (Knock on door) Will the two of you excuse me?
Sorry, I have company.
I don’t want to hug you.
Blue, as in depressed.
I don’t know what colour lonely is.
Red is angry, yellow is frightened, green is jealous and blue is depressed. Perhaps we can assign a colour to lonely.
All right. Come in. You look positively orange with loneliness. No, I don’t see that catching on at all.
I’m working on my three-person chess game.
It’s three-person chess. Did you bring a friend?

Then as a mental exercise I invite you to figure out why the two of us can’t play three-person chess. Can you believe this guy? Social protocol does, however, require me to bring you a hot beverage in your time of need.
It’s not optional. We’re out of tea. I hope you like bouillon.
Actually, I was wondering if I could add a third new chess piece. How do you think people would feel about Prince Joey, the king’s feeble-minded but well-meaning cousin?
The fun thing about Prince Joey is every time he moves, there’s a one-in-five chance he’ll kill himself.
Yellow. Go ahead.
Fascinating. What’s in it?
I like cows.
It was its own point. Go on.
Rajesh, I’ve had the privilege of working alongside you for many years. My recommendation is that you gobble these up like Tic Tacs.
I’m glad you think so. That’s what I strive to emulate.
Oh, there’s no need to interact with me. I’m just here to observe.
All right.
I’d like to buy a scone.
They sound delicious, but this money is earmarked for scones.
They were out of scones.
My catapult flings my bishop to Howard’s Queen’s Gorilla two.
When it’s done charging. Or you land on the time machine. Obviously.
I knew I should have given my Pope the jet pack.
Priya: Oh, would you please stop feeling sorry for yourself?
We shared a room growing up. This is not news to me.
Have you been spending time with your ex-girlfriend?
Then why are you surprised she didn’t tell you?
I’m sorry. What would an astronaut be doing working on a movie?
Yeah, I think it will be.
Oh, God, no. We’re not there yet.
You’ve been in there a lot tonight. Are you okay?
Raj: The lonely guy and the two happy couples? I’d rather get a prostate exam from a leper who walks away with nine fingers.
I have to feel sorry for myself. I’m the only one who cares. Just like I’m the only one who’ll have sex with me.

Excuse me. I’m going to go wander the streets alone. Invisible, unwanted and unloved, a pathetic shadow in a city with no heart. (Leaves, then returns a moment later) I forgot my windbreaker. It’s chilly.
I need a hug.
Come on, Sheldon, open the door.
I don’t want to hug you, either. I was just feeling blue.
Well, not so much depressed as lonely.
What?
Nothing rhymes with orange. It’s probably lonely.
What are you doing?
Oh, cool. Can I play?
No.
No, thank you. I’m fine.
I, uh, I guess you’re probably wondering what’s got me down.
I’m going to be 30 years old, and I have no one in my life to love me. I’m such a basket case, I can’t even talk to a woman without having alcohol in my body.
Sheldon, listen to me. I have a big decision to make, and I’m scared.
A friend at the School of Pharmacology gave me these new pills they’re testing. He says it’s the next big thing for social anxiety disorder.
I’m not sure. Some sort of beta-blocker attached to a molecule extracted from the urine of cows.
That’s not the point.
I’m a scientist. My ability to think is my bread and butter. I’m afraid if I take this, I might lose that special, unique something that makes me so successful in my field.
Thank you for coming with me, Sheldon. You’re a good friend.
Okay, let’s see if this drug works.
Forgive me for staring, but you’re very beautiful.
India.
It’s a beautiful country. You’d love it. May I join you?
My name is Dr. Rajesh Koothrappali, and this is my friend Dr. Sheldon Cooper.
We’re scientists. We observe everything. Here, go buy yourself a scone.
And what is your name?
Oh, derived from the word angel. Appropriate.
Wait, where are you going? We were doing so well. She never even got to see my penis. Ta-da!
Amy: Good news: the wildebeest is in the curry.
Howard: Then the studio must have real faith in it.
I’m not going to help you. This is hilarious.
Okay, I’m still trying to work this out. How did Penny meet an astronaut?
Most of those guys live in Texas.
I’m not grilling you, I was just curious.
It’s nice to have another couple to hang with, isn’t it?
Nice to see that the gals are getting along.
Okay, well, it’s getting late. This was terrific. You win. Bernie?
Nice. Okay, rook to transporter pad. And he comes out at Leonard’s Queen’s Bishop
Penny (to the shoes): All right, guys, you have to go back. I can’t afford you. “No, don’t send
Bernadette (in Raj\u2019s bathroom): I think they’re on to me. The story’s starting to fall apart.
Woman: Thank you. That’s a great accent. Where are you from?
Oh, cool. I’ve always wanted to go there.
Server: Oh, I’m sorry, we’re out. We have muffins.
Raj (taking his shirt off): Oh, just getting comfortable. So how long have you lived in Los Angeles?
Raj (removing his trousers): Sheldon, I’m talking to someone. You’re being rude. I’ll bet you’re an actress. If not, you should be. You have a very expressive face.
